bg.x2d.math

Class FloatMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.math.FloatMath

  • public class FloatMath
extends Object
    Provides static methods to perform various float operations either not provided by the java.lang.Math class or implemented differently. This class does NOT replace the Math class and only provides mostly operations regarding float precision.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FloatMath() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean equals(float arg0, float arg1) 
      static boolean equals(float arg0, float arg1, float round) 
      static int getPrecision()
      Default is 9 decimal places.
      static float pow(float arg0, long power)
      A much faster, simpler method of raising a number to an exponent than Math.pow, at the cost of accuracy.
      static float round(float arg0, int n)
      Returns the given float value rounded to n decimal places.
      static void setPrecision(int precision)
      Sets the math precision value for floating point numbers.

      • pow

        public static float pow(float arg0,
        long power)
        A much faster, simpler method of raising a number to an exponent than Math.pow, at the cost of accuracy.
        Parameters:
        arg0 - a number raised to the 'power'
        power - nth power
        Returns:
        the first argument raised to the power of the second argument.

      • round

        public static float round(float arg0,
          int n)
        Returns the given float value rounded to n decimal places.
        Note: the current precision setting of the FloatMath class does NOT affect the result of this method.
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the float value to round
        n - the scale (number of places) to which the float should be rounded
        Returns:

      • setPrecision

        public static void setPrecision(int precision)
        Sets the math precision value for floating point numbers.
        Parameters:
        precision - number of places to the right of the decimal to round.

      • getPrecision

        public static int getPrecision()
        Default is 9 decimal places.
        Returns:
        precision - number of places to right of the decimal to round
